nlp_embedding.py

NLP module to handle the NLP embeddings. Can process both text or tuples of text. If tuples of text, their outcome will be concatenated.

This module contains the following classes:

  • NlpEmbedding

This module contains the following functions:

  • None

class nlp_embedding.NlpEmbedding(model_name: str = 'distilbert-base-uncased')[source]

Bases: object

Class to handle the NLP embeddings.

Parameters:

model_name (str) – The name of the model to be used for embeddings.

tokenizer

The tokenizer used for tokenizing the input data.

Type:

AutoTokenizer

embedding_model

The model used for embeddings.

Type:

AutoModel

device

The device used for training the model.

Type:

torch.device

get_embedding(text

str): Gets the embedding for a given text.

property device: str

The device used for training the model.

Returns:

The device used for training the model.

Return type:

device (torch.device)

get_embedding(inp: str | tuple, pooling_strategy: str = 'mean') → Tensor[source]

Gets the embedding for a given text.

Parameters:

  • text (str or tuple) – The text to be embedded. Note: If tuple, the embeddings will be concatenated. Thus, the output will have a shape of (n, m) where n is the number of elements in the tuple and m is the embedding size.

  • pooling_strategy (str) – The pooling strategy to be used.

Returns:

The embedding for the text.

Return type:

embedding (torch.Tensor)

unset_device() → None[source]

Unsets the device used for training the model.

This is done so that the device can be set again. It has to be done manually so it is hard to do it by accident.

Returns:

None
